resources.string: Influenza is a viral infection that attacks your respiratory system — your nose, throat and lungs.
The human immunodeficiency viruses (HIV) are two species of Lentivirus (a subgroup of retrovirus) that infect humans.
The Aichi Virus is a member of the Kobuvirus genus in the Picornaviridae family.
Chikungunya is a viral disease transmitted to humans by infected mosquitoes. It causes fever and severe joint pain.
Cosavirus is a genus of viruses in the order Picornavirales, in the family Picornaviridae. Human serve as natural hosts.
The cowpox virus is closely related to variola, the causative virus of smallpox.
Dhori virus (DHOV) is a species of the genus Thogotovirus and a member of the family Orthomyxoviridae.
The virus is enzootic in eastern Africa, and closely related viruses occur in Nigeria (Dugbe virus in cattle), and in India and Sri Lanka (Ganjam virus in sheep
Hantaan orthohantavirus (HTNV) is an enveloped, single-stranded, negative-sense RNA virus species of Old World Orthohantavirus.
Rapid risk assessment: Novel coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) pandemic: increased transmission in the EU/EEA and the UK – sixth update.
